name: Marcgravia umbellata
description: Marcgravia umbellata is a climbing shingling vine native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Marcgraviaceae family and exhibits the characteristic shingling growth pattern where juvenile leaves cling flat against surfaces as it climbs. The plant features small to medium-sized leaves that create a layered, shingling appearance. The plant displays a climbing, shingling growth habit and typically reaches 10-40 cm in height when grown in terrariums. It produces small flowers in umbel-like inflorescences. In its native habitat, it grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks and branches in tropical rainforests, receiving filtered sunlight through the dense canopy. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds unique visual interest with its shingling habit. It's popular among terrarium enthusiasts for its distinctive climbing growth pattern.
careTips: Requires high humidity (60-80%) - ideal for terrariums
Prefers bright, indirect light - avoid direct sunlight
Keep substrate consistently moist but not waterlogged
Can be mounted on wood or grown in well-draining mix
